Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Co-organizzatore degli ''Statistical and econometric seminars", dip. Metodi e Modelli per l'Economia, il Territorio e la Finanza. Facoltà di Economia, Sapienza Università di Roma.
Relatore al convegno "Prague Stochastic 2010". Prague (Czech Republic).

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Sapienza University - Research grant n. C26A12P8S9: project on Bayesian Networks' structural learning by Rank-based test for conditional independence in multivariate time series, 4.000 Eur.
Sapienza University - Research grant n. C26A13WJ8C: project Statistical Measures of Connectivity in City Networks, 7.000 Eur.
Sapienza University - Research grant n. C26A15X79H: project Integrating Big Data, Social Media and the Official Statistics to develop Job placement and Occupational Monitoring Indicators, 8.000 Eur.

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Granted Visiting Professor. University of Southampton. Research topic: Robust Small Area Estimation. Invited by Dr. Nikos Tzavidis and Prof. LiChun Zhang. The visiting was granted by InGRID funds.
Mathesia Contest Math & Food, 1st classified. Project: Food for cities: the Urban Tool. Awarded at Milano Expo (Italy). June 18th 2015.
Visiting Senior Lecturer. Cornell University. United States

Internal Board of the PhD in Statistics and Economics at Sapienza University (http://w3.uniroma1.it/dcnaps/servizi/dottorato.htm)

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Energeya S.r.l., Project: Wind power forecasting models
7th Framework European Program, grant agreement n. 244251: project Solutions to Environmental Contrasts in Coastal Areas (SECOA) 84.336 Eur.
Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (ESS Division) Project:Integrated Survey Framework for Agriculture Surveys. - Global Strategy (FAO).
Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (AGS Division) Project: Meeting Urban Food Needs.
Si.Camera and The Italian Ministry for the Environment, Land and Sea. Project: Economic development and environmental sustainability in coastal areas.

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Econometric Consultant at CONSIP S.p.A, (Italian Ministry for Economics),Econometric Modelling Division. I provided research assistance and technical support (database management) for the Italian Treasury Econometric Model (ITEM).

2006--2007. Université Libre de Bruxelles-Department des Mathématiques. Maitre d'enseignement. Brussels, Belgium. Teaching activities and practical organization (exams, seminars, tutorials) of the Statistics and Probability II-year course for undergraduate students in Economics. Course duration: 36 hours per year (taught in French). Teaching activities and practical organization (exams, seminars, tutorials) of the Statistics and Probability II-year course for undergraduate students in Economics. Course duration: 36 hours per year (taught in French).
2006--2008. Università Europea di Roma- Faculty of Economics. Course: Mathematical Analysis. 1st year undergraduate students in Economics (taught in Italian).

Researcher at the Belgian Statistical Office, Survey Design Unit. Brussels, Belgium. Main duties: integration and coordination of business surveys, elaboration of the structure of the Belgian IBS (Integrated Business Survey), sampling design, robust calibration for outliers and non-response, statistical methods for reducing business response burdens using administrative data, training statisticians to the use of SAS software (Data-Management, Reports, Basic Statistics). Courses taught: SAS Enterprise-Guide (taught in French).

Head of Methodological Research Unit the Federal Public Service - Economy, Sectors, Markets and Monitoring Division. Main responsibilities: coordinator and principal investigator for the AGORA project in collaboration with KULeuven (Prof. Verboven) and HUBrussel (Prof. Eyckmans). The aim of this project is the construction of statistical indicators and an econometric model at the sectoral level for the {\bf Policy Evaluation} and {\bf Monitoring} of the Belgian economy. Main duties: Advanced Econometric and Statistical Analysis concerning markets of goods and services, with the objective of monitoring supply and demand prices, policy evaluation on the development of competitive domestic and foreign trade markets. Besides this, I also provide a substantial contribution and statistical support to the quarterly reports on price evolution, specific studies on sectors of economic activities (especially food and energy). I developed lecture notes that I use now for training economists to Statistics and Econometrics to the use of SAS software (ETS/STAT/BASE). Courses taught: SAS Data-Management and Programming (taught in French), SAS Enterprise Guide (taught in French).
Cornell University Senior Visiting Lecturer, Department of Statistical Sciences. United States.
